action.action-desc: Mr. Issa introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Homeland Security, and in addition to the Committee on Education and Labor, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to provide eligibility to elementary and secondary schools for certain security grants for target hardening and other security enhancements to protect against terrorist attacks, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Nonprofit and School Security Grant Program Act.

section.header: Eligibility of elementary and secondary schools for certain DHS security grants

subsection.text: Section 2009 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 609a) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the section heading, by inserting and school after nonprofit;
in subsection (a), by inserting and to elementary schools, secondary schools, private schools, and religious schools before for target hardening;
in subsection (c)(1), by inserting , including magnetometers before the period;

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking $75 million for each of fiscal years 2020 through 2024 and inserting $500,300,000 for each of fiscal years 2023 through 2027; and

subclause.text: by striking $50 million and inserting $125,075,000; and
by striking and after the semicolon;
by striking $25 million and inserting $125,075,000; and
by striking the period and inserting ; and; and

clause.text: by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: $250,150,000 is authorized for elementary schools, secondary schools, private schools, and religious schools, to be derived initially from the unobligated balances of all amounts made available to such schools to prevent, prepare for, or respond to the coronavirus.

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: In this section, the terms elementary school and secondary school have the meanings given such terms in section 8101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801).
The table of contents in section 1(b) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended by amending the item relating to section 2009 to read as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 2009. Nonprofit and school security grant program.
